entry.title: The Non-Domestic Rating (Alteration of Lists and Appeals) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: The Non-Domestic Rating (Alteration of Lists and Appeals) Regulations 1993 govern the alteration of non-domestic rating lists and the appeals in relation to such alterations.

entry.title: The Agricultural Holdings (Fees) (Scotland) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order sets out the fees which are chargeable by the Keeper of the Register of Community Interests in Land for the provision of services relating to the registration of tenants' interests in buying land under Part 2 of the Agricultural Holdings (Scotland) Act 2003 (asp 11).

entry.title: The Education (Student Loans) (Repayment) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Student Loans) (Repayment) Regulations 2000 (“the 2000 Regulations”). The amending regulations concern the provision of information to the Department by borrowers of student loans and the imposition of penalties upon failure to do so. They also increase the earnings threshold for repayment.

entry.title: The Disability Discrimination (Questions and Replies) Order (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: This Order revokes and replaces the Disability Discrimination (Questions and Replies) Order (Northern Ireland) 1996 which prescribed the form of a questionnaire which could be used by a person (“the complainant”) who considered that he may have been discriminated against by another (“the respondent”) contrary to any provision of Part II of the Disability Discrimination Act 1995. The 1996 Order also prescribed a form for the respondent’s reply and laid down specified periods within which the questions had to be served by the complainant in order to be admissible in proceedings before an industrial tribunal.

entry.title: The Contaminants in Food (England) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply in relation to England only and revoke and re-enact with changes the Contaminants in Food (England) Regulations 2003 (S.I. 2003/1478) —make provision for the execution and enforcement of Commission Regulation (EC) No. 466/2001 setting maximum levels for contaminants in foodstuffs (OJ No. L77, 16.3.2001, p.1, as corrected and amended) (“the Commission Regulation”); and,implement—Commission Directive 98/53/EC laying down the sampling methods and the methods of analysis for the official control of the levels for certain contaminant in foodstuffs (OJ No. L201, 17.7.98, p.93, as amended),Commission Directive 2001/22/EC laying down the sampling methods and the methods of analysis for the official control of the levels of lead, cadmium, mercury and 3-MCPD in foodstuffs (OJ No. L77, 16.3.2001, p.14, as corrected),Commission Directive 2002/26/EC laying down the sampling methods and the methods of analysis of the official control of levels of ochratoxin A in foodstuffs (OJ No. L75, 16.3.2002, p.38),Commission Directive 2002/69/EC laying down the sampling methods and the methods of analysis for the official control of dioxins and the determination of dioxin-like PCBs in foodstuffs (OJ No. L209, 6.8.2002, p.5, as corrected and amended),Commission Directive 2002/78/EC laying down the sampling methods and the methods of analysis for the official control of the levels of patulin in foodstuffs (OJ No. L203, 12.8.2003, p.40), andCommission Directive 2004/16/EC laying down the sampling methods and the methods of analysis for the official control of the levels of tin in canned foods (OJ No. L42, 13.2.2004, p.16).

entry.title: The Local Authorities (Capital Finance and Accounting) (Amendment) (England) (No. 2) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Authorities (Capital Finance and Accounting) (England) Regulations 2003 (“the Principal Regulations”) and apply only in relation to local authorities in England.

entry.title: The Roads (Amendment) (Northern Ireland) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order amends the Roads (Northern Ireland) Order 1993 to enable proceedings required by Articles 67 to 67B (environmental assessment), Schedule 7 (vesting orders) and Schedule 8 (orders in connection with roads) to be taken concurrently.

entry.title: The Financial Assistance for Young Farmers (Northern Ireland) Order 2004

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Financial Assistance for Young Farmers (Northern Ireland) Order 2004

entry.summary: This Order confers powers on the Department of Agriculture and Rural Development to make grants to young farmers.

entry.title: The Employment Relations (Northern Ireland) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order is made only for purposes corresponding to the purposes of the Employment Relations Act 2004 specified in section 58 of that Act. It amends the law relating to the recognition of trade unions and the taking of industrial action, makes provision about means of voting in certain ballots, the rights of trade union members, employees and workers and proceedings before the Certification Officer. The Order contains other miscellaneous amendments to employment relations law.

entry.title: The European Communities (Designation) (No. 6) Order 2004
entry.summary: This is a further Order in the series designating authorities which may exercise the power to make regulations conferred by section 2(2) of the European Communities Act 1972 and specifying the matters in relation to which that power may be exercised.

entry.title: The Maximum Number of Judges (Scotland) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order amends section 1(1) of the Court of Session 1988 so as to increase the maximum number of persons who may be appointed as judges of the Court of Session from 32 to 34. The Order revokes the Maximum Number of Judges (Scotland) Order 1999 which had previously increased the number to 32.

entry.title: The European Convention on Cinematographic Co-production (Amendment) (No. 3) Order 2004
entry.summary: The European Convention on Cinematographic Co-production Order 1994 (“the Principal Order”) provides that films made in accordance with the European Convention on Cinematographic Co-production (Cm 2495) are to be treated as British films for the purposes of Schedule 1 to the Films Act 1985. For the Convention to apply where there are only two co-producers one must be established in the United Kingdom and the other in one of the countries set out in the Schedule to the Principal Order. For the Convention to apply where there are three or more co-producers one must be established in the United Kingdom and at least two others in different countries set out in the Schedule to the Principal Order.

entry.title: Merchant Shipping (Oil Pollution and General Provisions) (Isle of Man) Order 2004
entry.summary: The International Convention on Civil Liability for Oil Pollution Damage 1969 (the CLC), which was extended to the Isle of Man by the Merchant Shipping (Oil Pollution) Act 1971 (Isle of Man) Order 1981 (the 1981 Liability Order), provides uniform rules and procedures for determining questions of liability and for awarding compensation when damage is caused by pollution resulting from the escape or discharge of oil from ships.

entry.title: The Landfill (Maximum Landfill Amount)(Northern Ireland) Regulations 2004

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Landfill (Maximum Landfill Amount)(Northern Ireland) Regulations 2004

entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 2(1)(d) of the Waste and Emissions Trading Act 2003 (“the Act”). Section 23(1) of the Act, as amended by regulation 2 of the Landfill (Scheme Year and Maximum Landfill Amount) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/1936; “the earlier Regulations”), defines “scheme year” and “target year”.

entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Oil Pollution) (Gibraltar) Order 2004
entry.summary: The International Convention on Civil Liability for Oil Pollution Damage 1969 (the CLC), which was extended to Gibraltar by Schedule 1 to the Merchant Shipping (Oil Pollution) (Gibraltar) Order 1976 (the 1976 Order), provides uniform rules and procedures for determining questions of liability and for awarding compensation when damage is caused by pollution resulting from the escape or discharge of oil from ships.

entry.title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Minimum Funding Requirement and Actuarial Valuations) Amendment Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Occupational Pension Schemes (Minimum Funding Requirement and Actuarial Valuations) Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/1536) (“the MFR Regulations”).

entry.title: The Child Abduction and Custody (Parties to Conventions) (Amendment) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order amends the Child Abduction and Custody (Parties to Convention) Order 1986 to add Brazil and Lithuania to the list of Contracting States to the Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction, done at The Hague on 25th October 1980 (Cm. 33); and to add Lithuania to the list of Contracting States to the European Convention on Recognition and Enforcement of Decisions concerning Custody of Children and on Restoration of Custody of Children, signed at Luxembourg on 20th May 1980 (Cm.191).

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) (Amendment) (No.3) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations increase some of the fees payable under the Motor Vehicle (Driving Licences) Regulations 1999.

entry.title: The Courts Act 2003 (Commencement No. 8, Savings and Consequential Provisions) Order 2004

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This version of the The Courts Act 2003 (Commencement No. 8, Savings and Consequential Provisions) Order 2004 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: Education (Listed Bodies) Order (Northern Ireland) 2004

ukm:Subject.Value: HIGHER AND FURTHER EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT

category.term: HIGHER AND FURTHER EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT

entry.summary: This Order repeals and replaces the Education (Listed Bodies) Order (Northern Ireland) 2003.
